item.title: CVE-2023-28092|2023-05-01T14:46:03.772Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- hpe%20proliant%20rl300%20gen11
item.description: A potential security vulnerability has been identified in HPE ProLiant RL300 Gen11 Server. The vulnerability could result in the system being vulnerable to exploits by attackers with physical access inside the server chassis.

item.title: CVE-2023-38486|2023-09-06T17:48:38.025Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- 9200%20series%20mobility%20controllers%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%2C%209000%20series%20mobility%20controllers%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways
item.description: A vulnerability in the secure boot implementation on affected Aruba 9200 and 9000 Series Controllers and Gateways allows an attacker to bypass security controls which would normally prohibit unsigned kernel images from executing. An attacker can use this vulnerability to execute arbitrary runtime operating systems, including unverified and unsigned OS images.

item.title: CVE-2023-38402|2023-08-15T18:47:59.783Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- hpe%20aruba%20networking%20virtual%20intranet%20access%20%28via%29
item.description: A vulnerability in the HPE Aruba Networking Virtual Intranet Access (VIA) client could allow malicious users to overwrite arbitrary files as NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM. A successful exploit could allow these malicious users to create a Denial-of-Service (DoS) condition affecting the Microsoft Windows operating System boot process.

item.title: CVE-2023-38401|2023-08-15T18:16:47.513Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- hpe%20aruba%20networking%20virtual%20intranet%20access%20%28via%29
item.description: A vulnerability in the HPE Aruba Networking Virtual Intranet Access (VIA) client could allow local users to elevate privileges. Successful exploitation could allow execution of arbitrary code with NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM privileges on the operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-38484|2023-09-06T17:47:18.689Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- 9200%20series%20mobility%20controllers%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%2C%209000%20series%20mobility%20controllers%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways
item.description: Vulnerabilities exist in the BIOS implementation of Aruba 9200 and 9000 Series Controllers and Gateways that could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code early in the boot sequence. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain access to and change underlying sensitive information in the affected controller leading to complete system compromise.

item.title: CVE-2023-38485|2023-09-06T17:47:29.963Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- 9200%20series%20mobility%20controllers%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%2C%209000%20series%20mobility%20controllers%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways
item.description: Vulnerabilities exist in the BIOS implementation of Aruba 9200 and 9000 Series Controllers and Gateways that could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code early in the boot sequence. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain access to and change underlying sensitive information in the affected controller leading to complete system compromise.

An authenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the AOS-CX Network Analytics Engine. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system, leading to a complete compromise of the switch running AOS-CX.

item.title: CVE-2023-22785|2023-05-08T14:03:55.974Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20access%20points%20running%20instantos%20and%20arubaos%2010
item.description: There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in multiple underlying services that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.description: A vulnerability exists in Aruba InstantOS and ArubaOS 10 where an edge-case combination of network configuration, a specific WLAN environment and an attacker already possessing valid user credentials on that WLAN can lead to sensitive information being disclosed via the WLAN. The scenarios in which this disclosure of potentially sensitive information can occur are complex and depend on factors that are beyond the control of the attacker.
